name: Fomento Económico Mexicano, S.A.B. de C.V.
description: Fomento Económico Mexicano, S.A.B. de C.V. (FMX) is a leading beverage and retail company based in Mexico, recognized for its extensive portfolio that includes soft drinks, bottled water, and retail operations. Founded in 1890, FMX has grown to become one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola products in the world, serving millions of customers across Mexico and Central America. The company operates through various segments, including beverages, food, and retail, with a strong emphasis on sustainability and community engagement. FMX is also involved in the production and distribution of snacks and other consumer goods, positioning itself as a comprehensive provider in the consumer sector. The company is committed to innovation and efficiency, leveraging modern technology to enhance its production processes and supply chain management. With a focus on corporate social responsibility, FMX actively participates in initiatives aimed at promoting environmental sustainability, supporting local communities, and improving public health through responsible beverage consumption. FMX's mission is to enhance the quality of life for its consumers and stakeholders while delivering value through its diverse product offerings and responsible business practices.

faq.question: What does FMX do?
faq.answer: FMX is a major beverage and retail company, primarily involved in bottling Coca-Cola products and operating OXXO convenience stores.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of FMX?
faq.answer: Daniel Rodríguez Cofré is the CEO of Fomento Económico Mexicano, S.A.B. de C.V.

faq.question: Where is FMX headquartered?
faq.answer: FMX is headquartered in Monterrey, Nuevo León, Mexico.

faq.question: What are FMX's main products?
faq.answer: FMX's main products include Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta, bottled water, and convenience store offerings through OXXO.
